summary: This bill, the Disaster Loan Accountability and Reform Act (DLARA), aims to improve oversight and accountability within the Small Business Administration's (SBA) disaster loan program. It mandates enhanced reporting on loan activity, sets limitations on loan obligations when funding is low, and requires various reports from the Government Accountability Office (GAO) and the SBA Inspector General regarding the program's financial performance and administration. The bill also addresses budget requests and forecasting related to disaster loans.
